content: felted bag pouch/clutch/purse by karousel knitting 1 overview this charming felted bag is a quick knit perfect for gifting or using up leftover feltable yarn it s a versatile project that can be easily customized in both size and style use it to store knitting needles and notions school supplies makeup or small essentials inside your larger bag to adjust the size simply add more row for extra height or cast on additional stitches for a wider bag you can finish your bag in a variety of ways add an i-cord string or leather strap to turn it into a small purse or crossbody bag skip the zipper by casting off half of the stitches and continuing with the remaining half to create a flap closure the flap should measure about half the total length of the finished bag after felting the result is 22 x 13 cm sturdy soft and durable bag with endless customization possibilities e g embroidery yarn drops alaska the bag pictured on the front used 75 grams yarn alternatives any feltable yarn will work gauge 13 sts x 17 row = 10 cm x 10 cm before felting needle size is only a guide if you get too many stitches on 10 cm change to a larger needle size if you get too few stitches on 10 cm change to a smaller needle size the gauge is not too important because the bag will be felted materials 5 5 mm circular knitting needles 20-25 cm zipper instructions cast on 74 sts using 5 5 mm circular needles knit in the round until 22 cm bind off using a classic bind off sew together the bottom following below felting instructions the zipper is added after felting felting instructions note washing machines can vary so you may need to adjust these steps slightly for your machine 1 prepare for felting place your finished knitted object in the washing machine along with a couple of towels the towels help provide agitation which encourages felting 2 select the wash cycle i use a quick wash program that normally runs about 20 minutes at 30 °c 2 however i increase the temperature to 40 °c which extends the run time to roughly 30 minutes and speeds up the felting process 3 add detergent use regular non-wool detergent i ve found that using regular detergent instead of wool detergent makes a big difference it causes the fibers to felt faster and more evenly 4 check progress after the first cycle when the cycle finishes check your piece it should already be felted meaning the stitches are no longer visible or able to be undone but it may still feel a little floppy 5 run a second cycle optional but recommended to achieve a firmer and more durable finish i run a second wash cycle using the same settings after this the object becomes noticeably sturdier and holds its shape better 6 felting multiple items if you re felting a pair of
